data.author: semiprocoder
data.description:
This watchface is a fully functional binary clock. Each row of blocks represent a binary number, with (currently)blue signifying a zero and yellow signifying a one.

The center shows the hours:minutes, and below that it shows the seconds.
The top shows days:months.
Lastly, the bottom shows you the last two decimal digits of the year converted to binary. In this case, the fifth box is filled in, which equals 2^(5-1)=16, as during the time of taking the screenshot it is 2016.

Stay tuned for updates, as I will try to release them. I will possibly add more functions, such as telling you the battery level or whatnot, and I will hopefully add settings that allow you to customize the colors for this watchface.

If you like this app and want to support me, you can do so by donating here:
http://andrewkrapivin.xyz/donate.html
data.title: Binary Watch

data.author: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.
data.description:
Ana/Digi Round
Analog and digital Round watch face.

Designed to fit round pebbles, bu it also works in pebbles with rectangular screen.

The digital box is placed right into the middle of the largest unused √°rea left by the hours and minutes hands.
The digital time is displayed in 12/24 hrs format, according to your settings; and the date is displayed in your current language.

I did this face because of a fan's request,
(: a fan is a fan! :)
who has the necessity of reading the time both in the 12 and 24 hours modes at the same time. This can be done by setting the Pebble in 24 hrs format and reading in 24 hrs using the digital box; and reading the 12 hrs mode using the analog hands.

Enjoy!  :)
data.title: Ana/Digi Round

data.author: Nev Rawlins

changelog.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.  Reuires Pebble firmware V4.0.2 or later

Fixed problem where previous weather icon displayed when Bluetooth connection lost on restart. Now blanks in the same way as temperature and location. Basically having all these blank indicates either no API key supplied for the chosen provider or Bluetooth connection lost on a restart.
Weather Underground sometimes returns daytime icon values at night.  This is now converted.

data.description:
Cryptic weather watchface, based on my "Balloons" watchface (I couldn't resist the name "Weather Balloons").

Minute balloon floating within an hour balloon - "tails" (lines) from each pointing towards the appropriate markers telling the time.  Color of hour balloon reflects day/night (based on sunrise/sunset).

Weather providers: OpenWeatherMap, Forecast.io or Weather Underground.  As with many other weather watchfaces, you need to get a free API key from the weather provider you want to use.  All give at least 500 free calls per day (far more than needed). Until API key provided, weather icon & temperature areas are blank.

To get key, register at one of these:
 OWM: https://home.openweathermap.org/users/sign_up
 Forecast.io: https://developer.forecast.io/register
 Weather Underground: https://www.wunderground.com/member/registration 
 (select Columus Plan to get forecast info)

All find weather for current latitude/longitude.

Temperature appears in minute balloon (Farenheit/Celcius), weather icon within hour balloon. 
  
With Forecast.io & Weather Underground, option to present balloons with forecast for today & next 4 days on a shake of the wrist.  The "tails" are in hour analog positions (0 for today, 1 for tomorrow etc).

Balloons can be ordered:
- Rising: Today highest, then tomorrow etc
- Analog: Arranged around face in analog sequence

For Quick Views, location name and forecast inhibited. 

Animation sequence:
  2:40AM (San Francisco)
  3:55PM (Shanghai)
12:30PM (London)
5 day forecast (rising)
5 day forecast (analog)


Design & Code Copyright ¬© 2016 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble 2 and Quick Views.  Reuires Pebble firmware V4.0.2 or later

data.title: Weather Balloons

data.author: Dr. Antonio Aguilera.
data.description:
Versi√≥n 1.5 is here!

This watch face handles 12 or 24 hrs format.

When it is set to 12 hrs, it is a standard analog face, numbers are displayed with no leading zero and an am/pm indicator is displayed next to the current hour (see example 2).

When it is set to 24 hrs, the numbers change as in example 1, so that the hours hand always points to the correct hour. The displayed numbers have a leading zero (if needed) and they range from 5 hours before the actual hour, to 6 hours after. 

The date is displayed in your own language.

The face is green if bluethooth is connected, red if not. It also vibrates if it loses or gains bluetooth connectivity. 

Enjoy!
data.title: 12/24 Hrs.

data.author: Kenny L.

changelog.release_notes: Updated some memory enhancements
Fixed weather icon

Fixed problem with having random team chosen and auto updates (it will not update information for your randomly selected team).
Added indicator for bye, as well as now randomly selecting a "team to beat" and setting countdown (if chosen) to default.
Also fixed some stability issues (though there is sometimes some trouble.  If the logo isn't showing up, simply change the screen [aka look at timeline or your app list] and it should go back to working just fine!)

Removed crashes (I hope!)
More frequent updates when a game is being played
Minor edits
Minor edits

MAJOR UPDATE!
New Features:
-Current Weather - and choose to use Weather Underground for tighter control
-AUTOMATIC NFL INFORMATION!!! - Allow the watch to automatically pull what team your favorite is playing this week!  It can also pull the gametime automatically to count down to, and it'll even show the current score if it's available!

Cleaned Features:
-Minor Text fixes
-Cleaner settings page
-Smarter code
-All around better

Features to come:
-More frequent updates when a game is being played (right now updates are locked into weather updates - so if you aren't using Weather Underground that's hourly)
-Weather at game site
-Weather forecasts
-Timeline pins
Moved text layers so they do not appear in the wrong spot with peak.
Added Diorite Support and peak support
Initial release.  See NCAA FBS Watchface for previous version information.

Timeline QuickView enabled. All colors configurable (thousands of combinations possible). Languages English, German, Dutch, Spanish, French and Italian. 12/24 hour display. US/European date format. changelog.release_notes: distance fix

countdown fix

stays on the running watchface for 60 s without reverting back to sit or walk modes while not running for a while. Shows countdown for the last 30s before discarding the run to motivate you to start running again.
+ run visibility fix

+ option to invert the screen

bug fixes

Option to disable seconds and turn on the day of week.

First release

data.description:
Multiple fitness watchfaces in one. Automatically detects standing/sitting, walking and running. Each activity has its own watchface.

Sitting: an elegant watchface with all the required items (time, date, the weather, battery for watch & Android phone, your daily progress)

Walking: same information, but the step count and your daily progress are more visible

Running: watchface turns into a fitness watch - shows the duration of the run, the distance and the pace (min/km or min/mi). Will support heart sensor on P2 and T2.

When you stop running, the watch will continue to show your run for a minute. If you start to run again during this minute, the run will resume. The watchface doesn't need your phone for GPS while running. It gets information from the watch.
data.title: MultiFit

data.author: Josh Weaver

changelog.release_notes: With recent new of Pebble being sold to Fitbit, I have decided that I am going to make my watchface free for everyone to use and enjoy. Thank you to all that have previously purchased my watchface! Your support is greatly appreciated.
Minor release to update Clay and KiezelPay libraries

This is a BIG update to DigiVerge. Complications are now fully customizable. Choose where and what you want to see! This update also features animations and the ability to "shake to hide" your complications for that clean analog look.

Future updates will include more options for different complication types.

Thank you for your support!
This release is to support OS4.0. Future updates on the way!
Some more coding updates...
Misc. updates
Initial release of DigiVerge!

data.description:
This watchface has a sleek and modern design with features that are customizable. Set the information and colors you want to see on your wrist! Complications can be located at any of 6 locations. The size of the watch hands are also customizable!

Features:

   ‚Ä¢ Customizable Colors
   ‚Ä¢ Custom Complication Locations
   ‚Ä¢ Shake to Hide Complications

Optional Complications:
   ‚Ä¢ Time
   ‚Ä¢ Date
   ‚Ä¢ Weather (Temp and or Conditions)

Weather is powered by Yahoo!

If you enjoy this watchface, please leave a heart. Feel free to send me a comment or let me know if there are issues or features you may want.

data.author: Phil Hazelton

changelog.release_notes: * Added support for Fahrenheit / inches of mercury units
* Fixed first load of weather data after configuration update

* Switched weather provider to Weather Underground, for better forecast accuracy and improved detail
* Clearer display of day & night time forecasts
* Larger date font
* Current location display
* Low battery and charging notifications
* Configuration screen

data.description:
A straightforward watch face that prioritises time, date, health and weather in a clear and compact display.

From top to bottom you see:
* Current pressure / temperature / humidity
* 3-day weather forecast (blue for rain, yellow for sun, grey for clouds etc. including night times based on real-world sunrise and sunset times)
* Current location
* Low battery and charging indicators (not shown)
* Digital time display
* Weekday and date
* Step target indicator for current time of day
* Overall daily step progress (red if below target, green if above)
* Distance / step count / active calories

Weather updates based on current GPS location, every half hour for maximum battery savings. Step goals are automatically set based on averaged data.

NOTE: Due to restrictions in the Weather Underground API you will need to register a free account at wunderground.com and enter your own key on the configuration screen.

Coming soon:
* Optional vibrate on disconnect
* Background colour options
* Connection status indicators
* More unit options (including miles)

latest_release.release_notes: * Added support for Fahrenheit / inches of mercury units

Few Key Features:
- Readable Time and Date always

- Night Mode. UI turns dark at late night until 5AM.

- Background turns Red when battery is 10% or less (Color Screen only)

- Time and Date morphs depending on the time of day and even the date

- Vibrates when Bluetooth disconnects

- It may also greet you a Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year.

You get a 3 hour free trial!

  Remember Power0? Yeah, the watch face that lets you keep the cool looks even when your at low power? Well, your upgrade just arrived: Power1!

data.author: Kjeil
data.description:
This is a balanced ternary watch face for hours and minutes.

The top row is hours past noon.
The bottom row is minutes past the hour.

The figures sets change randomly once an hour:

The red symbols are -1, 
The black symbols are 0, and 
the red symbols are +1.

If all the negative 1 symbols were "-", 
all zero symbols were "0", and 
all positive 1 symbols were "+",
then the following would be an example.

Example of how to read.
        +    -    -   hours
   -    +    +   +  minutes
*27 *9  *3  *1

The time shown above 14 minutes before the 5th hour past noon

or 4:46 pm.

9 - 3 - 1 is the hour which = the 5th hour past noon, or 5pm.

-27  + 9 +3 +1 is the minute which = -14 or 14 minutes before the hour.
data.title: Trit-Clock R

data.author: Kjeil
data.description:
This is a balanced ternary watch face for hours and minutes and seconds.

The top row is hours past noon.
The middle row is minutes past the hour.
The bottom row is seconds past the minute.

The figures sets change randomly once a minute:
The red symbol is -1
The black symbol is 0
The blue symbol is +1

If all the red symbols were "-", 
all the blacks were "0", and 
all the blue symbols were "+",
then the following would be an example.

Example of how to read.
        +    -    -   hours
   -    +    +   +  minutes
   -    0    -    +  seconds
*27 *9  *3  *1

The time shown above is 29 seconds before 14 minutes before the 5th hour past noon

or 4:45:31 pm.

9 - 3 - 1 is the hour which = the 5th hour past noon, or 5pm.

-27  + 9 +3 +1 is the minute which = -14 or 14 minutes before the hour.

-27 + 0 - 9 + 1 is the second which = -29 or 29 seconds before the minute.
data.title: Trit-Clock RS

data.author: Arne Wichmann

changelog.release_notes:
This release has improved handling of the "shake" gesture:
Shake once: Normal activity.
Shake ~3 times: Increase weights.
Shake ~10 times: Reset weights.

data.description:
The watchface displays time in adaptive precision, depending on the user activity detected on the watch. 
The precision is calculated using weights on an activity log over the last minute, hour, day, and month. The weights are increased on tap/shake events, as well as button interactions. The weights are decreased with time. 

Current steps are:
HH:MM:SS, HH:MM, HH::MM (in 5 Minutes), HH MM (in 15 Minutes), HH, Day of Week, Month, Year

latest_release.release_notes:
This release has improved handling of the "shake" gesture:
Shake once: Normal activity.
Shake ~3 times: Increase weights.
Shake ~10 times: Reset weights.

data.description:
Deprecated - this app is provided "As Is" and can be used, but there will be no further development or bugfixes.

aBIGtime is a simple text watch face with really big numbers for good readability. It shows time and the current date (weekday / day), on wrist shake health data (sleep in the morning, steps after 2000 are reached) is shown for 3 seconds.
 
aBIGtime features Clay offline configuration for:
- NEW: Notify on Bluetooth disconnect
- Show health as default (date on wrist shake)
- NEW: Step Goal (notify when reached)
- Colors (background, numbers, date/health infor)

CREDITS: This app uses the free "Rubik" font (licensed under SIL Open Fonts license http://scripts.sil.org/OFL)
 
DISCLAIMER: I created this for my personal use on a Pebble Time, and I'm sharing it in the hope that it might be useful for you, too. Use at your own risk, and if you have any bug reports or suggestions let me know, I'll see what I can do.

data.description:
Show you what weather is going on in the future.

Request to update weather hourly and keep the 5 day / 3 hour forecast data. Therefore you can see the change of weather oncoming.  
 
You can set one reminder and show it as line on the timeline of weather wave. while on start or end, the watch will buzz to remind you. 

V1.7 above, is ready to synchronize with AndroidPhone's system calendar, and show Two Schedules as the reminder line on the weather timeline.
You need to download the Companion App(widget) and sideinstall it. Load the widget and reset your phone, and then enjoy this watch face.
The widget will synchronize periodly automaticly, or manually by pressing the analogclock included.


The weather and max/min temperature on top screen is the forecast data for tomorrow (and the day after).
Below that, is the start time of next reminder or schedule if you have.


The Companion App :WW widget 1.3 :
http://pan.baidu.com/share/link?shareid=3759337882&uk=3422589443

data.author: hexahedria
data.description:
Watchface that shows the time with a continuous spiral. Outer spiral completes a revolution every hour, and inner spiral completes a revolution every 12 hours.

How to read: Outer endpoint of the thin colored spiral acts like the minute hand of a clock. Outer endpoint of thick white spiral acts like the hour hand. Alternatively, count the number of revolutions made by the colored spiral to find the hours.
 
 Featuring different color schemes for AM and PM.
data.title: Continuous Spiral Clock

data.author: David Watson

changelog.release_notes: This release disables weather refresh when the watch does not have a connection to the phone, this could be caused because bluetooth is disabled on the watch or the phone, but more likely the phone app is not communicating with the watch and the phone app needs to be force closed and reopened.

This release resolves an issue where if you get more than 9999 steps you would wrap the step count off the screen and get a comm badge logo.  I also blank the weather status when weather is loading, in case your phone killed the pebble app and you passed a weather refresh window.  I also display the time when an error occurs retrieving weather, which is displayed below the saucer section.  I am also allowing the weather description to flow off the screen rather than wrapping the text...which only came up when it is Mostly Cloudy outside.

This release is all internal workings.  Fixed an issue with the step progress bar, but more importantly squashed a bug when communication with the iOS app.  This version also dealocates memory used for weather if you are not using that component.  Also, with Pebble killing the Time2 my reason for using fctx mentioned in the previous release notes is no longer necessary...so I am going to skip converting to fctx and live with fixed font sizes.  So sad to see that happen, I can't find anything else quite like it out there that is waterproof, always on and viewable in sunlight, and programmable.

So after some fustration on for everyone, I stopped using the pebble's app_timer function and wrote my own.  This prevents me from sleeping as deeply, but performs reliably which is more important.  The options to disable these functions now also work and I changed the idle timeout to 45 minutes

For whatever reason the 30 minute idle timer is not working correctly when the update first installs on your watch. The variable is defined correctly, it simply isn't running correctly. I changes the way I am defining the variable in this version slightly hoping it would fix the issue

More changes =good:) Sleep has been improved to display 8888 as the time when sleeping to be clearer that the display is intentionally not updating. Sleep is also now interrupt based so it takes less battery to check and sleeps deeper. Also added an option to disable sleep. Replaced the confusing manual sleep with IDLE, which is very similar to sleep except that it detects lack of movement for 30 minutes and goes to idle. Shake your wrist to wake up your watch or use the options in the pebble app to disable. This release is also the first release compatible with the Time2, although honestly the text looks crappy due to SDK limitations. I am in the process of changing certain text elements to scaleable vector graphics, which should save space on both platforms.
Got rid of a 1K block of floating point code and fixed the average display when the user has less than a week of data in pebble health

Big changes for v2.0 and see the new website https://sites.google.com/site/pebblelcars/ for full details.  I got the BadKey bug squished, fixed a small memory leak, you can now change the text color, you have a step goal, there is a neat animation when you achieve the step goal, the watchface sleeps with you now, there is a manual sleep option.  I believe you will have to save your settings once to reinitalize the settings for v2.  Enjoy

Changed the health meter to simultaneously display your progress to your instantaneous average steps in green and to your average daily steps in blue.  Also added an option to replace the weather with a custom message entered in the settings menu.

I don't know what happened in 1.7, pebble crashed when I published the app and for some reason that blanked several text fields on the watchface.  This is identical to 1.7 except the text description is 1 character longer.
Added an option to display a text version of the weather (the very last config item) as well as moved the enterprise slightly so it no longer touches the LCARS interface

Bug fix to the weekday name being too wide in some circumstances.  I also neglected to mention the health meter changes colors based on the goal.  It will fill up with green if you select your current average, ie you are trodding about town.  It will be blue when the daily average is the goal, the sky is the limit.  I should also mention that the goal is defined by the average for this day of the week (ie all Wednesdays) , the pebble health app appears to use a slightly different average.  Just FYI

Added the name of the day of the week at the upper left (default on and setting to turn off), and various formats of the week of the year near the top left (default hidden with 3 formatting options to turn on).  I am also trying to work out some other code, but didn't want to keep you waiting too long

Added user options for hiding the battery percentage, option for displaying the stardate in UK format, and fixed a few garbage collector type issues.  I also moved the health meter text within the progress bar and added an option for the progress goal to be either the average steps for today as of this minute, or the average steps for the entire day.  If you select the former, remember a prolonged rest could make your progress bar go backwards
Enjoy the flexibility to choose one of three weather providers

Welcome to weather on your LCARS Interface.  The app now uses pebble-events and there is also a settings page, which caused a major rewrite, so get yourself OpenWeatherMap so get yourself an API key and enjoy.  More is on the development list so stay tuned for more updates

It doesn't look very different, but under the hood there are a lot of changes.  The entire LCARS interface is now interactively drawn rather than a simple bitmap (which makes the app smaller and will enable me to change the color scheme at the users wish in a future settings page), the bluetooth icon is now drawn instead of a bitmap, the Bluetooth icon turns red when disconnected, I fixed the health meter progress bar to proper progress towards the full daily average, and I temporarily filled in the daily average steps near where the weather is going to be displayed.  I went to the Star Trek Experience at the Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum in New York to do some research as well.  Based on that I have fine turned the curvature of the LCARS elbows and the relative size of the buttons and bars, though I did take some small liberties near the edges for style.  The colors used are also based on the LCARS panels on the bridge scene at the museum and matching visually to my pebble time the resulting color.  I haven't got any emails yet and please consider providing input though I do see a few favs...thanks for that.  The actual enterprise is still a bitmap because I can't get pdc vector conversions to display on the pebble.

This is alpha V0.11 Release and fixes a bug where the health could exceed 100%. I have not put in the weather functionality, a settings page, or tewaked the font layout for the small text. I am working on it and I would greatly appreciate your feedback

I am still getting the hang of snprintf so this fixes the display of the number of steps. All else still applies This is alpha V0.1 Release. I have not put in the weather functionality, a settings page, or tewaked the font layout for the small text. I am working on it and I would greatly appreciate your feedback

data.description:
The captain has assigned the task of implementing an effective display for his wrist based ship status device, it has been many years since the academy but this lieutenant is up for the task.  The task mandates the design maximize the amount of information displayed and be very configurable, however feedback from other starfleet officers is welcome via the support email link. 

The 21st century concept of monetary compensation does not apply and the code is open source
https://github.com/ddwatson/Pebble1701LCARS .  Attribution required if using the code.

Big changes again for v2.4 and please see the website https://sites.google.com/site/pebblelcars/ for a description of all the features of the watchface.

See the version information for the latest info and please remember to provide input via support

latest_release.release_notes: This release disables weather refresh when the watch does not have a connection to the phone, this could be caused because bluetooth is disabled on the watch or the phone, but more likely the phone app is not communicating with the watch and the phone app needs to be force closed and reopened.

data.description:
When you select a 24-hour display will appear temperature in Fahrenheit units. 

If you wish to Celsius display, please change the setting of the 12-hour display of Pebble time.

If you wish to reverse the above, Please use the FCBarcelona.
